title: Something's In the Walls
body:
It all started on a Sunday. My Sunday usually consists of waking up anywhere but my bed, groggy with a pounding hangover with blurry memories from the night before. It was a ritual I always performed with my roommate and best friend Simon, my stereotypical gay best friend.

I found myself passed out in the closet, a new one for me. But not for Simon. My headache was worse than ever, a constant throbbing in both temples that started as soon as I came to. I forced myself out of the awkward neck-breaking position I had been in with my face against a pair of heels, my body cracking. A pair I had never seen before in my life. I stood, a bit wobbly on my feet and stretched to reach the cord to turn on the light. What I saw made my blood run cold, my eyes widen as I recoiled from the string in horror.

"SIMON! WHY IS THERE A USED FUCKING CONDOM HANGING IN THE CLOSET?!?!"

I don't wait for an answer, dodging the offending rubber as I burst from the closet. I freeze, taking in the destroyed apartment as I search for a familiar head of red curls.

I spotted a half naked blonde guy hanging half-on and half-off the couch, realizing I didn't recognize the model-like male. Alrighty then, I thought in my best Jim Carrey voice as I move on to the kitchen. Nothing was amiss in there, as the room was always a mess. I suddenly snap my fingers, realizing he was probably in his usual Sunday spot. I move towards the bathroom and sure enough, there was a skinny pale guy with crazy curly red hair with his head hanging in the toilet. And not the dyed kind, but high quality ginger, I thought.

Simon was well and truly passed out, which was okay because my attention was on the wall across from the toilet. There against the floor was a fist sized hole, which I wouldn't have given another thought other than the fact it was against the floor. I knew the partying would catch up, the place was always a mess so we were bound to get pests of some type eventually.

Maybe I should have given it more thought. ...

After a few hours I cleaned up best I could after some coffee, and shooed out the blonde guy without asking any questions. I really didn't want to know what happened Saturday. I even dared to get the condom down, closing an empty pizza box on it and using it as makeshift tongs.

I sat at the kitchen table nursing a cup of coffee with both hands, slouched to make myself small as if that would help chase off the headache.

"I feel as if I swallowed glass." A voice croaked from the bathroom doorway, causing me to jump. I grin when I see Simon swaying dramatically in the doorway, and nudge my coffee his way. He gratefully grabbed it as he collapsed in a chair, taking a large chug even though steam still rose from it.

"Who knows, might have deepthroated the whole Cactaceae family." I mutter, earning a blank look from Simon.

I sigh.

"Cactus, Simon. Cactus."

He snorts, leaning back with his chair causing it to tip precariously.

"Next I'll hit up the succulents." He wiggles his eyebrows, and I don't bother correcting him.

"We really need to cool it down next Saturday." I say without feeling, the words sounding hollow even to my ears. Sure enough he grins, and I'm ready for the returning comment.

"Don't you say this every Sunday, Dee? Only to be the first one to break out the Jägermeister the following Saturday?"

I ignore this, standing to begin the dishes making sure I swipe the coffee he had been in mid-sip with and dumping it saltily down the drain. So what, I liked to drink. Black licorice is a weakness of mine, and unfortunately for my body and head Jäger tasted just like that.

My cleaning sluggish attempt as washing dishes was interrupted by the buzzing signaling someone wanted in the apartment, and I quickly placed a soapy finger against my nose so fast I splashed myself in the face.

"Not it." I sputter through suds, attempting to use my oversized t-shirt to wipe it. My usual Sunday garb, a t-shirt so big it fell to my knees, and nothing else.

"Fuuuck. Fine bitch, but next time it's on you." Simon peels himself from the chair and disppears, buzzing up the person without even asking who it was. We didn't have to wait long to find out, as minutes later a familiar hellish sound was heard. The sound of heels against the tile in the hallway outside the apartment. I release the longest, most frustrated groan in my arsenal. Even Simon looked perturbed, and without a word moved to lock himself in the bathroom. I only wish I could join him.

I paste on a smile as I open the door, revealing my mother in mid-knock. As soon as she saw me her lip curled and she wrinkled her nose as if she smelled something rank. Which, granted, she probably did.

"Oh Deidra, you look a wreck." She murmurs as she sweeps inside without even asking, her crimson dress swishing as she moved.

"Thanks Mom, good morning Mom. Nice to see you too Mom." I mutter between clenched teeth, shutting the door with a bit more force than necessary.

"I'll make this quick, just wanted to wish you a happy twenty-first birthday." As she spoke she eyed the living room with obvious distaste, her eyes lingering towards the kitchen. Where Simon was holed up in the bathroom.

I blink, shocked in silence for a few moments as I quickly count the days on my fingers. Well I'll be a monkey's bare-assed Uncle.

"Oh, of course. Thanks I guess." I play it off as if I didn't totally forget my own birthday, reminding myself to get on Simon for not giving me a heads up.

"So... Wh- Er I mean to say, How is the apartment treating you?" My mother stammers a bit, but collects herself nearly instantly. I narrow my eyes, as she had never stammered a day in her life.

"Good. I actually need to clean, so thanks for stopping by." I shut it down, not up for small talk. Besides, I knew Simon wouldn't come out until she left. Which, I didn't blame him. Though I did express if she said one more homophobic comment to or about him I wouldn't allow her over ever again.

It shut her up for some reason at the time, but Simon never tested it out. Really, he just didn't want me to cut off contact with my mom. Sweet, but unnecessary.

"Oh, well alright. Call me if anything happens." She says with a tight smile, taking the cue and heading for the door. I wait until she leaves before heading towards the bathroom, talking as I go.

"Clear, come on out." I call, pausing to try the door. It was locked, which again wasn't unusual. The lack of response however was.

"Simon! You fall in, dork?" I bang on the door, but again nothing. Now I'm picturing him having fallen out and cracking his head against the sink in a pool of his own blood.

I decide against knocking down the door like in cop shows, instead I fetch a knife and use it to jimmy the lock open. Takes me a few tries and lots of cursing, but finally I get it. I pause, a sudden deep and foreboding feeling appearing in the pit of my stomach. I tighten my hold on the knife, slowly swinging the door open.

This time, I scream. And I don't stop.

...

Usually when one sees blood on TV it seems fake and unreal, something that one couldn't help but scoff at. This was nothing like that.

Crimson smeared the walls, the ceiling, all over the floor and mirror. It especially surrounded the hole in the wall, a hole that somehow was now several feet in diameter. My breath was coming in ragged gulps, and I noticed distantly that the edges of the hole were ragged. But as I grew nearer I realized it wasn't that they were ragged, oh no. The edges were stuck with bloody chunks of something.

Hair. Human hair.

Simon's hair.

Now I was near hyperventilating, I forced myself to slowly back out and shut the door, and I even went as far as moving the table to barricade it from the outside.

I'm currently in the closet again, writing this. I'm scared, I don't know what to do or what the fuck happened.

I think something's in the walls.
author: AnnabeeBuzz
